name: Do No Harm (SAWD Games)
description:
Welcome to Hell, Josef. 

In life, you brought pain and misery to those seeking your aid.  You broke your oath.  Now, you will spend eternity paying penance for these sins.  Your unending task is to provide comfort and care for all of my demons, as they spend their own eternities doling out the pain that you yourself are forbidden to cause.  You will do no harm, ever again.

A SAWD Games production.

Made in 3 days for Mini Jam 120: Hell2 in November 2022. This is our second Mini Jam, and this time we tried to limit our scope to a much smaller game, but what that left us with was of course a much smaller amount of gameplay. If we had more time to work on this, we would certainly have tracked and displayed your maximum streak throughout the work day, and probably would have tried to add another twist on the core game mechanic to mix up the patient interaction a bit.

To cure each affliction presented by the demons on your surgery table of the damned, you must press the displayed series of directions quickly and accurately.  Hesitation or mistakes will cause you to start over.

Controls:

[Arrows] or [WASD] - heal patients

[Enter] - confirm menu selection

[Escape] - pause

Made in Godot 3.5.1

Font:

Shlop by Raymond Larabie

https://www.1001fonts.com/shlop-font.html

Art:

Demon Sprites from Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup

https://github.com/crawl/tiles

Additional Art by Craiyon

https://www.craiyon.com/

Edited UI Assets by John Day

Fire Shader from Godot Shaders

https://godotshaders.com/shader/2D-fire/

SFX:

GUI Sound Effects by LokiF

https://opengameart.org/content/gui-sound-effects

Some of the sounds in this project were created by David McKee (ViRiX)

soundcloud.com/virix

select_006.ogg from Interface Sounds by Kenney

www.kenney.nl

Steam Whistle by bart

https://opengameart.org/content/steam-whistle

Music:

Dark Events by Michael Robinson Homingstar

https://opengameart.org/content/dark-events

Standby - Relaxing Jazz by migfus20

https://opengameart.org/content/standby-relaxing-jazz

Names and ailments come from real life historical data of deaths from 1600s England
